text: I agree with the previous review and you can definitely find better restaurants in new orleans and buyer beware : the food does not live up to its hype .

acme has a welcoming atmosphere to a city guy and old and not much natural light and bustling and and kind of dirty like every bar should be ,I ate here twice for quick lunches and my first experience was better and seated at the oyster bar and the shucker was quite friendly and after serving me 10 oysters (I ordered the half dozen ) he asked how I enjoyed them and "I dont touch 'em, " he replied to my favorable review and it was pretty funny ,I also had the seafood gumbo and their signature po'boy and which were both decent ,go for oysters and beer .
excellent sensible priced local food and recommended and very casual .

do not go here for oysters if you value your dental work and went here in december and have just finished dealing with fixing a crown that was broken as a result of pieces of shell in the oysters ,save yourself the headache and literally hundreds of dollars in dental bills by going somewhere else .

oysters upon oysters and no better place to have them than where you have to wait in a line in the rain for a table ,well worth the wet toes and damp hair and we had the oysters raw and oyster shooters and the chargrilled oysters ,my favorite was the chargrilled oysters and garlic and parmesan and herb butter are the best combination for a warm oyster and dipping your bread in the sauce is even better ,I would wait in like again if I had to and these oysters and fast service are well worth it !

the wait was a worth it and raw oysters - a bit dirty but quick to be served po boy shrimp - break was crisp and flaky and warm and delicious and shrimp were great as well ,medley platter - gumbo was good but the jambalaya was by far the best dish and beans were good served over white rice and crab cake - deep fried and had a pretty good taste and cons - long wait lines and small portions and pricey and overcrowded and takes a while to get your food but the food is pretty good and our server was a sweetheart .

this always is a must stop on our way to texas and this trip and I tried the medley gumbo and on average it was a 3* but the gumbo was a 5 * plus and hush puppies a 3* . not a big oyster fan and so can attest to thier offerings and great atmosphere and we had a table by a window and this afforded us a view of the street traffic and great time and food .

the food was decent but to be honest and there's nothing I would come back for and the only dish I thought was good were the hush puppies only to discover even better hush puppies at b & c seafood market & cajun restaurant in vacherie to be better ,service and vibes were great though !
waited about 40 minutes for a table for two on a saturday night but totally worth it and the chargrilled oysters were to die for as were the fried crab claws and very highly recommended !

the oysters were fresh and delicious and the oysters are the only reason I'm giving them 2 and the smell at this location was very strong and we waited 30 minutes which wasn't bad however the lady cleaned our bar table with a dirty rag that had been sitting under all the menus she was handing out and which lead me to believe that it hadn't been sanitized in a while and silly me for not getting up and leaving but I wanted to see what the hype was and well needless to say I won't be back and the gumbo was blah not a lot of flavor and well this review is all over the pace but here it is !

get the charbroiled oysters with extra bread and tried a good amount of other plates and they were meh... dont bother with them and go for the oysters and thats it and seriously... everything else is basic nola food that is on every corner restaurant in the quarter... there are better ones for gumbo and jambalaya and po boys and red beans and rice.. etc but oysters.... here is where you want to go and remember and charbroiled oysters with extra bread ;)on top of that service is pretty bad... came with a party of 6 and our server only took one drink order from a person at a time... meaning everyone was waiting for drinks for over 20 minutes and none of us had a full drink at the same time... she would walk away in the middle of us ordering and forgot lots of things... it was wednesday afternoon so wasnt a busy saturday night or anything.. probably would come back only to sit at the bar and order oysters... wouldnt eat a real meal here ever again .

cash and card accepted and acme oyster house is located on iberville street and is accessible by foot and I did not see many street parking spots available nearby ,I went in on a weekday with my dad around 1:30 pm and it was the perfect timing because we only waited 5 min and the host and servers were super friendly and quick here ,I ordered a pound of crawfish and coleslaw and beans and rice and and soup and and my dad got the half shrimp and half fish combo and everything was really good and fresh and I would definitely recommend this place !
delicious grilled garlic and parmesan oysters to start followed by a shrimp po boy and washed down with a hurricane cocktail and tip top from start to finish

this restaurant is an overcrowdeddirty version of an old fashionedbennigans or applebees ,you are forced to sit at tableswith people you don't know ,service and food qualitywere below par ,will not return
try the po boys and there is always a line the oysters are good and the people at the oyster bar and their servers are very nice and we always stop when we go to new orleans .

fun environment and loved pretty much everything but the star for me was the chargrilled oysters and this was the first place I had them while in nola and proceeded to order them everywhere we went that had them and all of them were good but acme's to me were exceptional and would have loved to go back but just didn't have the time .
quality of seafood was fair but atmosphere here were just average and wouldn't be my top recommendation to someone visiting nola and had more of a diner feel than a seafood place .

had dinner here got there about 6 pm and waited in line for about 1/2 hour but totally worth the wait and dozen char grilled oysters were to die for and piping hot and perfect amount of cheese and garlic better topped huge oysters and just amazing and mkt price on 5/25/21 was $24 ,95 and worth every penny and also split a 10 napkin beef poor boy which are server michael suggested we make it a surf and turf by adding fried shrimp with a spicy honey sauce and that really made the dish and hubby ordered crawfish étouffée it was also good and pitcher of ambita amber $18 and total tab $74 and fantastic and don't miss the char grilled oysters here !

ordered an oyster shooter and the soft shell crab platter and seafood etouffee with fried crawfish and and jambalaya and everything was amazing and especially the softshell crab and the jambalaya was a bit heavier than other places we've tried but good nonetheless and the oyster shooter was interesting and and I'm glad I tried it and definitely a place to go when in new orleans!! !

second time around and acme still does not disappoint me and I know how crazy the lines are based upon my first trip to acme but surprisingly it wasn't too bad for lunch today and the line looked long but it goes really fast and for lunch today we had: - chargrilled oysters - raw oysters - fried fish and fries and soft shell crab platter - gumbo - jambalayaall dishes were amazing and full of flavor and the charred oyster is a must get and it was chargrilled with garlic and cheese and from what it looks like olive oil ? I can have a few more dozens of these and second best item to get and I would highly recommend is their fried fish and it was battered up lightly and the fish was so tender and moist and I had this last year when I visited new orleans and the taste and texture and freshness of the fish was still the same and each bite had its own crunch and I am in love and superb and jambalaya and gumbo was also amazing and my cravings were extremely satisfied! !

the line may be long but it's so worth it and charbroiled oysters!! and if you're gonna get one thing and get the charbroiled oysters and they serve it with a few slices of bread so you can sop up all the garlic butter sauce and everything else we ordered (po boys and fried fish and and gumbo ) weren't as memorable as the charbroiled oysters .
was closed today for a small fire and they told us they would be open soon and didn't see any damage .

this place has the best charbroiled oysters!! and service was great and the food was good and it was our first time in nola and this place was highly recommended by friends and it did not disappoint and we ordered 4 dozen charbroiled oysters and 1 dozen raw and oysters were so fresh it came out bubbling and the bread it came with was perfect for dipping in the sauce and we also ordered the crab cakes and it was a very generous portion and lots of crabmeat and gumbo was very tasty as well and I highly recommend this place if you're in the french quarters !
long lines are an annoyance but this is worth the wait and the chargrilled oysters lived up to the hype and the fried peace maker po-boy was totally delicious .
the chargrilled oysters were fantastic and the raw ones good too and we stopped in at the bar for a quick light bite and a drink and it was perfect and will go back .

wow-wee.....really a great spot for oysters and holy cow they were goooood and everyone is right and there is a line but it does move quick and we went on a friday night around 5:45 and there was a few groups in front of ours but about 20 minutes and we were in the door (the line behind us was stacking up fast and people kept coming!) . place is pretty small but the staff was prompt and attentive and put in our order for chargrilled oysters and some gravy fries and felt like minutes later they were back with our apps and both where awesome and the chargrilled oysters were definitely the bomb and I think they sprinkle crack on them and we had picky teenagers with us and even they ate the oysters and we had to fight them for the last couple and it was loads of fun and we ordered po-boy and beans and rice and bread bowl and gumbo and everything was okay but doesn't measure up to the oysters and we'd go back for the apps and oysters and beer but the rest of the food was just ok and we were in from out of town and tried several oyster spots before going here and well worth the wait but you must get the chargrilled oysters and you have better options for entrees but overall we were glad to find this spot .

the po ' boy is good and a reason to come and the shrimp and oyster po ' boy is my favorite and well-cooked but not the most flavorful in nola but it is better if you add-on onions and you have to get here by 5:30 at the latest to avoid a wait ,the jambalaya and etouffé and and gumbo are all super bland for how creole food should be and don't get them here at acme .

wow and just wow and  my memory must've been foggy because when I came over 12 + years ago and I didn't remember it being such a slam dunk!as you all know and this is one of those touristy places that you have to go to if you've never been to nola but for the record and let me tell you and it's so worth the trip and we tried felix and killer poboy and nola poboys all in the same week and none of these places served a better poboy than the peacemaker at acme and so ginormous and you can actually just share this and you'd still be full to the gills and get it and 5/5and contrary to popular opinion as new englanders and I'd also stuff your face with at least a half dozen of the chargrilled oysters as opposed to ordering the standard raw preparation and taste tested and confirmed as we ordered both and I know you're shocked and why you ask ? it's actually quite simple and the local oysters here from the gulf of mexico (on average ) are much larger yet more milder tasting so it's perfect to try these prepared in other cooking methods and  we absolutely enjoyed these and it's forever changed our perspective that a cooked oyster could never taste as good as the raw variety and 5/5  if you're into crab cakes and they do it quite well here too and ask for a side of their special house remoulade sauce and make sure you smother it well with it and you can work it all off later : ) 4/5really liked the decor of the place too and it added to the friendly and casual southern character you'd expect and service was all around friendly and we totally lucked out too since we were there during the slow season and didn't need to wait for a table and it's unheard of for this place and it's a "can't miss " spot and if the line is out the door and I'd suggest you try again to go on an off time and you won't be sorry !

good oysters and and other food options are good as well and got a po boy here and which was alright and tasted a tad bland and the service was quick and our waitress was nice and the wait can be long and the food is good but nothing really stands out to me here .

when in new orleans you absolutely have to stop by acme oyster house! and the food is delicious! and oysters were second to none and fried crab claws were da bomb! and they make their own cocktail sauce here too so it's got a nice bite to it!definitely coming back here next time I'm in nola! !

order the grilled oysters and skip the crawfish tail appetizers(not fresh and no taste good ) we had a few/several items from their menu... my suggestion is to go with the grilled oysters and can't go wrong homes
just eat all their oysters!! ' so damn good haha! and their fish po boy didn't disappoint either but lord those chargrilled oysters are worth every penny and every buttery calorie

this is a very casual restaurant but has great food and the gumbo in the bread bowl is the way to go and also the fried oysters with their special sauce is amazing and they serve it with break so you can soak up the juices and our server was very nice and the bussers were all very accommodating given we had 12 people sitting at an 8 person table and if you are looking for fresh seafood at a reasonable price and don't feel like getting all dressed up I suggest this place .

what an experience this place was and it was the first stop we went to for oysters and acme did not dissapoint and the crab corn chowder was delicious with large chunks of crab and plenty of sweet corn kernels and we only ordered the raw oysters and they came out perfectly shucked and the oysters were delicious and fresh and and had a clean flavor... but they were a tad bit too large .

atmosphere casual and busy and fun - - expect to wait in line and servicestaff is friendly and food comes out timely and foodgreat and we loved the side options and as we wanted to get a little taste of everything on our last night in new orleans and everything was tasty and the fresh oysters satisfied my craving and we tried the pecan cobbler dessert and which came in a martini glass and it was very good but a bit too sweet for me and of course and that did not stop me from eating it ; ) overalla good spot in the french quarter .

I had the crawfish etouffee and raw oysters and I felt felix's oysters fro and across the street was better but the etouffee was outstanding and noisier atmosphere than felix's but that was neither a positive nor negative and overall pretty good experience .
those chargrilled oysters are to die for!! and I can eat them all day and the food was great and and our server was so lively and would highly recommend! !

did I mention I love new orleans ? a local told us this was the best place to get oysters and man were we not disappointed and we ordered half a dozen charged grilled oysters and 2 oyster shooters and the new orleans medley and two drinks (one of them being a hurricane of course ) we sat at the bar and the service was excellent keeping great conversation with the guests while a shucking the oyster right in front of you and I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to eat downtown .

really wanted to like this place but it was super meh and I didn't mind the hour-long wait since you can grab a drink and hang out... but the whole experience just wasn't worth the wait and prices aren't too bad (but I'm from los angeles so I'm used to hyped up prices)... but overpriced for what the place provides ,first star off for the terrible service from the woman behind the bar and she looked miserable and like she hated her life and she didn't ask if we wanted a drink and she walked away mid-sentence when we asked a question about the menu and didn't ask if we needed anything else during our meal and no refills on our water and shrugged her shoulders when we commented about the terribly shucked oysters and took forever taking care of our check (you'd think she would wants us out of there with the long line outside!) . two stars off for the terribly shucked oysters and it's an oyster house so you'd think they'd get that right and oysters were large and meaty but every one of the two dozen raw oysters we ordered had shell shards and the grilled oysters had shell shards also and really ruined the experience and I saw people next to us spit out shell chunks and too and I love oysters and had more than 6 dozen during my few nights in nola... and this was the only place that had shell shards and terrible and grilled oysters were overcooked as well and (I actually recommend felix's across the street for fresh and meaty raw and grilled oysters ,)two stars because the boo fries are good (but suuuuuper salty) . gumbo and jambalaya were good but coop's does it way better and not worth the wait and so many other places nearby that do these better and super disappointed : (

charles h and said it all and it's simple enough to understand and the food was not worth the hype and I'd rather go across the street to felix where the line is short or non-existent and the oysters are large and where I can order the same dish and get a larger version and cheaper ,and if this is not long enough and then please and go shove the other reviews up your ass and , m .

don't let the line fool you and better places to eat despite being a "staple" . food is average and service is good (typical of nola) . selections similar to other restaurants and however portions smaller and ambiance very relaxed so less than casual attire and this visit did not eat there but stopped by so one one the guys can buy an acme tshirt (this place known to put them in an orange net nap sack which is kinda cool) . otherwise not recommended .

excellent food and a great atmosphere! and busy and noisy but fun! and well worth waiting in line to get into the place.... and we didn't have to wait too long anyway and I loved the place and if ever back in new orleans.... this will be one of the first places I go to! !

first off and there's always going to be a wait time to be seated and do yourself a favor and go around noon or early afternoon to avoid a long line and my friend and I decided to go around 1pm and only had to wait 5 minutes to get seated and I decided to try the chargrilled oysters and my friend had the new orleans specialty medley and it's easy to see why this place is so popular and the chargrilled oysters are delicious and some of the best I had in nola and the medley was great but I felt the portions to be quite small and regardless and it was more than satisfying and the place is dimly lit and while the space is large and you might have to share a table with others and the service was great and I will definitely pay them another visit next time I'm in town .

we were disappointed after all the good reviews and we sat at oyster bar because it was the first available seats but we didn't realize they were going to be just hard and backless and wooden stools otherwise we would have waited for a table and they could invest in some better seats and also and our server was not very friendly or attentive and the bright spot was that the chargrilled oysters were good .

if you love oysters 10000 % go and this place is amazing and the staff is so sweet and we loved the charbroiled or chargrilled (whatever they're called ) oysters and we still talk about this place all the time and we can not wait to come back in march ! !
freaking love this place and no pretentiousness but still a quality experience and don't wait in line across the street

great shrimp sandwich and not greasy and very tasty and charbbq oysters where amazing and they shuck them by the boat loads in front of you if you sit at the bar and it was like 25 degrees sitting at the bar with the ac blasting on you only reason for no 5 stars and when we mentioned it they did not lower ,next time we will get a table and soooooo awesome and reasonable prices .

came here with my cousin as we were wrapping up our cross-country road trip and they have some amazing oysters and price is a little high but then again and it's new orleans and this restaurant was very close to our hotel and is around the corner from bourbon street and great place and would recommend it .

a true new orleans must and the atmosphere is great... almost as good as the food and po boys are awesome but it's the raw oyster's that keep me coming back for more and this is always our first stop as soon as we hit the city limits !

ouuuu bayyy bayyyyyy!! and I finally made it over to acme oyster house and and mannnn... this seafood is everything I've ever wanted in a meal and I started off with an oyster shooter... scary and one of the kind gentleman chucking oysters at the bar gave me some cocktail sauce mixed with horseradish to chase my shooter with and it woke me up to say the least and I went with the charbroiled oysters on the half shell for my appetizer and and I was very close to licking the buttery goodness off the inner shells of the oysters and for my entree and I went with the seafood étouffée with the crawfish tails and the breaded crawfish tails made me dance just a little and the sauce was very flavorful and plentiful and the staff were very helpful and patient and and kind and it's not often you find a place where the entire staff is smiling and hustling and and just overall happy to be there and overall and my experience was amaziiiiiiiiinggggggg and and I will be back .

this place was definitely one of my favorites during my nola trip and the crab cakes were so delicious as was the seafood gumbo and for an entree my friend and I split the taste of new orleans....it was such a big portion and we showed up without any reservations and it took about 10-15 minutes to be seated and once we got to the table the service was friendly and pretty fast .
came here for a fast meal with good food and local beer and got both and the staff is great and very informative and a must stop if you are in the quarter !

even though it's right off bourbon street and it was still a little hard to find and got there around 5pm on a sat night and waited 5 min to be seated and they have an indoor and outdoor area and we sat indoor and we ordered the charbroiled oysters and their famous crab cakes and the pasta jambalaya and bread pudding for dessert and I also got the abita andy gator which apparently has something like 8 % alcohol but you can't tell and here is the breakdown and - charbroiled oysters - even though they are not as big as the ones at acme and I actually liked these better and these ones were sitting in a butter sauce and not just baked like the acme ones and they give you a spork (yes a spork and like the ones that you get at kfc ) to eat them with which actually goes well when eating oysters and the only drawback was that the bread it came with seamed stale - crab cakes - you get 2 decent size crab cakes...tasty but I wouldn't say mind blowing - pasta jambalaya - pretty good..came with shrimp and alligator sausage and it was a good change of pace from all that fried stuff and gumbo I had been eating and - beer - I really like the abita andy gator and it's got good flavor and is perfect for a hot daytip - we got a 10 % off coupon from one of those places selling tours and used it with no hassle .

top freaking notch and was a little skeptical at first but damn I'm glad we stopped and service was a little slow clearing plates but the waiter was so nice and professional and the food was seriously world class we had six in the party with a lot of different tastes and everyone in our group was happy even the vegetarian great over all
great food and and the server errol was awesome and would definitely visit again and we found this place thanks to yelp and visited on a week night and it wasn't too busy which was great .
I was very disappointed in my po boy shrimp sandwich since I came all the way to new orleans for the real thing and it was mediocre wish break & fried shrimp and nothing special .
by far the best mixed drinks and seafood in town!! and would highly recommend the tropical storm and the tuna steak!! !

this place was unreal and kim was a phenomenal waitress wjotook the time to write us a list of recommendations for activities like sight seeing and going to a jazz bar and getting coffee and the food was absolutely fantastic and we had a po boy and a red fin special and it was all so good and the hurricane was also quite good and the food tasted fresh and the french fries were crispy and just delicous and we will visit next time we are in that wonderful city

the mardi gras pasta is to die for and along with their cajun fries that's an appetizer and I made reservations the night before because the first night we thought about getting dinner there and the line was really long (not just there but literally every place we were thinking about dining in ) so reservations is the way to go and my only complaint is where we were sat felt like it didn't have any air what so ever so it made the time there a little uncomfortable especially since we had walked almost a mile to get there & it was 90 degrees and so some air would've made the experience a lot better and the food was amazing and I'm sure covid has a lot to do with the service and being short staffed & the current staff being stretched thin and our waiter was super nice and the only thing was I think our adult beverages weren't put in and we didn't receive them til we were already eating our entrees and even then that was not a major issue because if anything and they have to go cups and (also the bahama mama... wonderful! )

our friends from new orleans brought us here for lunch and it was so good and we came back for dinner that night with more friends and with each visit and we had about a 20 minute wait to be seated but it was definitley worth it and the sampler is great but I had to have the etouffee and it was the best etouffee I had in my entire stay in new orleans ,the hurricanes were not super sweet but just right and were served with dry ice and a nice touch and bread pudding was perfect !
we started with crab cakes with their signature sauce...excellent!!!my dinner catfish lafouche so gooood !

just ate and tried the redfish and it was the worst entree experience I've had in years and the oysters were great for an appetizer and the manager was nice but the foot was completely overlooked....came out cold....no crawfish included and I normally do t review but I could not help myself on this one .

you're looking for a recommendation on a great plate and sorry can't help you ,everything the four of us ate ; from apps to desserts were outstanding....and plenty of it and the 'surprise and delight ' were the gator bites and two different flavors with the texture between lobster tail and lobster claw get to bourbon st and go to oceana and and ask for darrick for great food and spectacular service
got the pain perdue and yum and its huge and their bloody marys are delish and a must go to place for at least breakfast .

this place is amazing and a hidden gem just off bourbon street and my husband and I split the crab cakes and 1/2 dozen grilled oysters and and blackened bayou duck and all suggestions from our awesome bartender megan and thank you megan!!! !
I love the blackened shrimp poboy from here and it's the best I found in new orleans ,be sure to check out the back patio if the weather is great .

I can not rave enough and the food was incredible and my first taste new orleans started with the barbecue shrimp which does not have barbecue sauce by the way but a great sauce made with butter and worcester sauce and the taste of new orleans was incredible and great portions and incredible flavor and the dining area had a nice environment with tons of people laughing and enjoying themselves it was relaxing and I will be returning here next trip and well done oceana !

we visited this restaurant last night for a few reasons... 1 ) it was a christmas and and most restaurants were closed and 2 ) it was open until 1am and and we had just gotten into nola on a late flight and 3 ) it was rated number one on yelp and we were a little nervous considering this restaurant was featured on kitchen nightmares but decided enough time had passed and improvements were probably made and was it horrible ? no and was it the best ? I wouldn't say that either and we ordered a shrimp po boy and oyster platter and the number one mistake I would say is that the food didn't come out hot... it was warmishly cold and the seafood tasted like it may have been frozen and the bread on my po boy was soft and didn't have much of a crunch (a little toasting could have helped) . service was prompt though and and the waiter was nice and overall and not a place I'd go out of my way to return to but if nothing else was open then sure I'd return and (tip : acme oyster house is my favorite seafood restaurant... not just in nola but possibly even in the world )
omg and the food was so good and filling and we took more than half home and had it for breakfast and the marzo gras pasta and red fish special with crawfish stuffing to die for .
good meal and huge portions....went back a second time and and shared with my wife....casual atmosphere...very reasonable pricing...will go back again...

I went this past sunday and recieved a recommendation from our server/bartender darrick he suggested the jambalaya pasta it was amazing just as his service,professionalism and personality and the drinks were great as well and I just loved the whole vibe of the restaurant and we were greeted with smiles and genuine hellos from the staff from the moment we walked in and went up the stairs and make it to the bar and that raising canes/chicfila training is awesome and lol but seriously I have to stop the manager phillip and let him know how great everyone was and the food and I will definitely return soon! and I recommend everyone go to the oceana on conti! and you wont be disappointed
great food served late and we are here twice and both times after 12mn and great service too and very friendly and helpful staff and food is reasonably priced

went here with my hubby for breakfast while in new orleans and I ordered a very basic breakfast - eggs and bacon and biscuit and and grits and the food was served piping hot as exactly as ordered and my husband is a bit more of an adventurous eater and had a cajun omelette which he loved and the food was excellent and our server-ponce - was magnificent and he was very attentive and pleasant and our experience here was fantastic on all accounts - from the service to the food to the cleanliness of the restaurant and try oceana grill - ask for ponce and you won't be disappointed !

I know all of my ratings for restaurants are high but it's because I read the reviews and do my research beforehand and after landing in new orleans for the first time we were looking for the perfect welcoming meal and found it at oceana grill right off bourbon st and very kind staff and am super glad I found it : ) *must try the gator tail appetizer * pictured : taste of louisiana

ordered a daily special- - a crispy skinned duck thigh topped with their famous mushroom gravy and craw fish and a side of corn and jambalaya and really fantastic dish and everything was mighty flavorful and best jambalaya I've had in town to be honest and very large restaurant with multiple floors and service was mediocre and not very helpful when it came to recommendations or beverages and minus a star and overall would recommend this place though and and they provide 10 % off coupons around town .

dined here on ny day and line was out the door but it moved quickly and thank goodness because it was frigid in new orleans and location was easy to access off bourbon street and it appears to be 3 levels with upstairs and downstairs bars and I sat on 3rd level which was open and spacious and with 3 tvs showing early football games ,I ordered the catfish ponchatran with collard greens on the side and the catfish ponchatran was excellent and for dessert and I ordered bread pudding with rum sauce and which was excellent and I topped it off w / kahlua coffee to warm the insides and staff was great with recommendations and prompt and courteous .

service was remarkable and waitor was very attentive on during sunday brunch and you may want to call ahead if you have a larger party and otherwise and it was easy getting a table for two and I would definitely go back to the restaurant if I am looking for good seafood and am willing to spend big bucks and definitely one of the better places near bourbon street !

my group of girlfriends and I went here with the desire of eating pasta and we ordered the crab cake pasta and crawfish fettuccini and we also ordered the blackened redfish that came with a side of jambalaya and greens and the crab cake pasta was mediocre - creamy buttery and the crab cake was typical but nothing amazing or extra ordinary and this was our favorite of the three dishes and the blackened redfish was pretty good and a little over cooked and almost dry in my opinion but nothing a squeeze of lemon couldn't help and jambalaya wasn't bad but greens were not delicious and the crawfish fettuccini was sadly terrible and I couldn't stand it anymore after one bite - the pasta was overwhelmingly fishy due to the fishy and horrible quality crawfish.. I was looking forward to this dish but it ruined my appetite and however and the third star is because of great service and ron recommended clubs for us to see and treated us with great hospitality .

very nice restaurant and red beans and rice was decent and jambalaya étouffée were not good and white chocolate raspberry martini and crawfish tails were very good and customer service was great and waiter was very respectful .

breakfast on saturday had a limited menu but met our needs and my husband had seafood omelette based on recommendation of our server and he was not disappointed and he said he could eat that omelette every day for a week and  I was looking for a lighter option not many choices and staff was pleasant and attentive .
definitely a sleeper cell on bourbon st and probably one of the most authentic red beans and sausage in the quarter and if you can handles the seafood platter I definitely suggest going for it !

loved the oceana grill in nola and it's a fun place and very energetic and I wasn't very hungry but how can you not come to nola and not eat ? we stopped in from our 6hr drive from atlanta and couldn't be more happy and I had the chargrilled oysters that were plum and juicy and the sauce on the oysters were a great added touch and I also had a cup of gumbo that warmed my heart of hearts and my mom who is pickier than I am enjoyed her food throughly and my son had the crab cake fettuccine and my husband had the trio and my son decided to get a desert that would knock you out of the park as it oozed with a bourbon sauce... and more importantly the wait was only 15min and we scored big time .

I was definitely impressed with the service and how large the restaurant actually is inside and the food was great and everything was cooked to perfection and had the taste of new orleans with blackened crawfish and will definitely be back!1 star -  total failure of an experience based on this experience would not return and would not recommend ,2 star - below average on several levels and not a total failure and wouldn't seek out to return or recommend ,3 star - average experience and minimum expectations met and nothing that says wow or that stands out and would return if someone else wanted to come and not a regular go to ,4 star - above average experience and will come here again and recommend to friends and family ,5 star - this will be a regular go to and will be highly recommended to people I know and exceeds expectations on a consistent basis .

we had blackened and fried gator - both were very delicious and the seafood gumbo was also great and prices were reasonable for the area and good service and this is a solid place for a snack and drink and outside patio area looks nice although we are inside .

this place was perfect for my family :)husband and 19 y daughter and 11 y son and & myself and prices are what I expected to pay in the french quarter but we splurged and we ordered taste of new orleans and to share ( it came split ) seafood platter-fried + crawfish tails and bbq bacon burger and spinach ravioli in oceania sauce - soooo dang gooood! - gator tail bites and 1 slice pecan pie & 1 bread puddin and 3 teas & 1 root beer float - checked in yelp and saved 10 % and paid $98 smackeroos!the portions are aplenty and flavorful and we are absolutely satisfied and leaving full & satisfied :)tip well here because these servers are attentive and and work fast and don't be a cheap-o and enjoy your time out here nawlins !

I am a server and so normally I'm very critical from that standpoint and however this restaurant provided excellent service with a very friendly staff and food and drinks were received exceptionally quick and and everything tasted great and eat here for a good taste of new orleans seafood !

the service is amazing and the waitress (sarah ) we had was super friendly and checked on us consistently and she brought us fresh glasses to take home for our souvenirs and only downside was the long wait time for our food and granted that's expected because this is an extremely popular place to dine at from what I've been told and sarah was still quick to tell us the kitchen was backed up but still ensured our water glasses never were below half way and this was a great experience due to sarah's knowledge of the menu and she ultimately helped me decide on the catfish platter sub the fries for the red beans and rice (side portion and small but super filling ) it's a relatively relaxed environment jazz music playing in the background and dimmer colored lights and still loud but it not too much and definitely can sit here and enjoy your watermelon margarita as I did and do be aware of we came in as a walk-in they take reservations for the evening/dinner crowd .

nice atmosphere and the waitress was good at explaining the different options on the menu and I went with the taste of new orleans but substituted the jambalaya for anextra bowl of gumbo and the gumbo was pretty good but not the best I've had and I didn't care for the crawfish etoufee and we got patron shots which said $7 on the menu but they charged us $8 and we got it rectified but that took over 20 minutes .
waiter was nice and food not so good and  if your stumbling in off of bourbon st ,half drunk you'll probably find the food ok ,desserts suck .

I've tried 7 different restaurants in new orleans all for the exact same dish : half a dozen of fresh raw oysters and this restaurant is the best and fresh and cleaned and no sand and maybe not the largest and most juicy oysters but definitely great and and the crawfish is just so delicious and the crawfish étouffée is seasoned perfectly and the fried crawfish tail is so crispy and tasty and I can literally lick the sauce off the plate !

~~~breakfast and lunch : brunch~~~10 % off with yelp check-inafter our morning tour around nola and our tour guide dropped us off near laura's candies and not too far from oceana and how did we decide to dine at oceana with several comparable restaurants nearby ? "discounts"...yes and it's very important to stretch your dollars while traveling and we were offered both the breakfast & lunch menu and I luv me some breakfast but I wanted to try the jambalaya on the lunch menu and our server was great and he filled us in on maw maw's cajun breakfast and not on the menu and it's jambalaya with scrambled eggs mixed in with a side of biscuits and big enough to feed two people and he had the kitchen staff split our plate for us and free of charge and it had a generous amount of shrimps and we both enjoyed our meals with the louisiana hot sauces that was available for us and excellent service and yummy food and happy tummies and not too shabby on the pocketbook and yep and we'll surely come back the next time we're in town .

great bartender and high quality food and no complaints...not a single one and I am not easily impressed and here I was and banana foster cheesecake was so good and I wanted to take another piece to carry home and gumbo - on point and crawfish etouffee - on point and red beans and rice - on point and I got all of these things in the taste of new orleans platter (subbed gumbo for jambalaya) . $16 and I ate like a queen and I cant wait to return .

wow and so disappointed and we started with appetizers which were only warm and that was the best thing about them and the bbq shrimp was over cooked and you got 5 shrimp for 12 bucks and the crab cakes were better but were more breading than crab and our drinks were super weak and after 5 drinks and 6 appetizers we spent over a hundred bucks and left there and went back to the hyatt and way more expensive but but great drinks and food .
this place was absolutely amazing and I was here for the first time with my girlfriend and we enjoyed it and a must try if you're in nola !

our first night in nola and tired from travel and wanted dinner close to our hotel but nowhere too raucous and the courtyard here was great and we shared the crabmeat cakes for an appetizer and they were amazing and also split dinner and the taste of new orleans and we loved it all and felt like a great first stop in a city we think we'll love ,one star off because service was a bit slow and very nice and polite and just a little slow .

this place is denny's on louisiana steroids + the decor and the food was good and some ups & downs and the restaurant is in the heart of bourbon st and , so I can see how the reviews and one great thing is that this restaurant is open late with a great atmosphere and food:blacken red fish : delicious and if I could order one dish and this would be it ,jambalaya pasta : cannot go wrong and another great recommendation ,cajun fries : more than I expected and I was expecting something dry and it is heavy in sauce and crawfish and not bad and blacken duck : taste like a heavily seasoned chicken ,crab cakes : taste like the ocean with extra salt and definitely not freshgreat option when lots of restaurants are closed .

there are very specific moments of my last trip to new orleans which spring to mind and and one of those is my dining experience at oceana ,two words : praline duckomg but let me back up...my friend anh and I initially entered and were seated near the front door and which turned out great for a spell because we were able to see and hear a brass parade going down the road and seriously and that's one thing I adore about nola and which really sets it apart for me ,once my husband arrived to join us and we asked if there was seating out on the patio and we were guided to a table in a central courtyard where we were surrounded by historic walls and windows going up a few stories and so the environment was already on a roll...enter the food and now and I don't normally gravitate toward duck but I was in new orleans and wanted to try something outside of my norm and when my eyes lighted on the words "praline duck, " I was hooked ,I am here to tell you today that it was one of my top 10 meals ever consumed and I ate every ,single ,bite and it was a perfect blend of succulent and sweet and I even got that look on my face when my husband (a notorious duck-lover ) swiped a bite ,I'm going back to nola this spring and will absolutely be stopping in for more praline duck !

excellent eatery this morning server was extra helpful and friendly and and knowledgeable of the menu and drink specials and special items of the day and there was an issue with our large party and I would advise to call ahead if so and otherwise overall great place

yum and yum and yummy and oceana grill saved new orleans!this summer and my daughter and I spent 2 weeks sampling local foods in biloxi and new orleans and I got so tired and bored with the standard fare of fried/broiled/grilled alligator and shrimp and crab cakes and sausage and trout and catfish and raw oysters and boudin balls that a single meal at oceana grill made the trip worth it and hallelujah!wherever we ate the quintessential jambalaya and etouffee tasted the same and there was a marked absence of vegetables of any kind - no greens at all and what ? it seems that all restaurants shared the same recipes and the same chef and  I am not a fried-foodie so I thought at some point I would see a vegetable but nooooooooo and none and not one ............... until oceana and  hallelujah and praise & thanks!at oceana and the food looked the way food should - no fried crust - just food that look good and tasted even better and I ordered the ''taste of new orleans' ' which sampled creole jambalaya and craw fish etouffee and red beans & rice with smoked sausage and sauteed vegetables - it did not disappoint at all and  free at last - I ate my belly full!my daughter ordered soft shell crab and oceana's famous oysters and oyster rockefeller and we almost bit into our fingers and yep and it was that goooooodddddd and hmmmm and hmmmm! and hmmmm and  I have never had anything that good - talk about the smokiness of the sauce and the mild cheesy flavor - it hit every taste bud on my tongue and good lawd have is mercy and the food was fantastic at lunch and the 'doggie ' was equally great the next day ,I recommend a stop at oceana grill the next time you visit new orleans and you will not regret it !

the rating and reviews are misleading and my friend and I got their "famous " oysters and gumbo and the sauce on the oysters is way too heavy and does not complement the oysters at all and the rice for the gumbo was hard and as if it was from previous day or refrigerated/defrosted and the service was not great either and aside from the nice hostess at the front and I wouldn't recommend this place for seafood but maybe the po boys are good .
